```{r}

# Data are pulled from Piper et al. (2017) The long shadow of senescence: age impacts survival and territory defence in loons. Journal of Avian Biology. 
# Only calculating matrix for females

## defining variables
# st = survival rate territory holders
# sf = survival rate floaters
# e = eviction rate
# r = resettlement rate
# c = chick fledge rate
# number_number = relevant age range

st1_17 = 0.94
st18_25 = 0.77

sf1_17 = 0.8
sf18_25 = 0.8

e1_17 = 0.13
e18_25 = 0.17

r1_17 = 0.33
r18_25 = 0.31

# values are estimated based on Figure 4. Values are not reported in report results.

c3_5 = 0
c6_8 = 0.4
c9_11 = 0.63
c12_14 = 0.63
c15_17 = 0.59
c18_20 = 0.66
c21_23 = 0.55
c24_30 = 0.44

## For matrix
# v = survival rate from chick to adult. Value estimated from Loon Project blog, Rough average proportion of banded chicks resighted as adults (2004-2015). In our model, chicks act as subadult floaters from years 1-3. We assume subadult yearly survival to be the cube root of chick to adult survival. 
# w = territory holder survives and maintains territory
# x = territory holder survives and loses territory
# y = floater survives and resettles on territory
# z = floater survives and stays floater

v = 0.15
v_cubed = v^(1/3)

w1_17 = st1_17*(1-e1_17)
w18_25 = st18_25*(1-e18_25)

x1_17 = st1_17*(e1_17)
x18_25 = st18_25*(e18_25)

y1_17 = sf1_17*(r1_17)
y18_25 = sf18_25*(r18_25)

z1_17 = sf1_17*(1-r1_17)
z18_25 = sf18_25*(1-r18_25)

# Creating Matrix A

col_names = list("0","1f","2f","3f")
for (n in 4:25) {
  nt <- paste(toString(n),"t")
  nf <- paste(toString(n),"f")
  col_names <- append(col_names, list(nt, nf))
}
col_names = unlist(col_names)

row_names = list("1f","2f","3f")
for (n in 4:25) {
  nt <- paste(toString(n),"t")
  nf <- paste(toString(n),"f")
  row_names <- append(row_names, list(nt, nf))
}
row_names = unlist(row_names)
```
